   20: 
   21: -module(receive_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Tests receive after.
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   28: 	 call_with_huge_message_queue/1,receive_in_between/1,
   29:          receive_opt_exception/1,receive_opt_recursion/1,
   30:          receive_opt_deferred_save/1,
   31:          erl_1199/1, multi_recv_opt/1,
   32:          multi_recv_opt_clear/1,
   33:          gh_5235_missing_save_reset/1,
   34:          gh_5235_recv_mark/1,
   35:          recv_marker_reserve/1]).
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap, {minutes, 3}}].
   40: 
   41: all() ->
   42:     [call_with_huge_message_queue,
   43:      receive_in_between,
   44:      receive_opt_exception,
   45:      receive_opt_recursion,
   46:      receive_opt_deferred_save,
   47:      erl_1199, multi_recv_opt,
   48:      multi_recv_opt_clear,
   49:      gh_5235_missing_save_reset,
   50:      gh_5235_recv_mark,
   51:      recv_marker_reserve].
   52: 
   53: init_per_testcase(receive_opt_deferred_save, Config) ->
   54:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
   55:         1 ->
   56:             {skip, "Needs more schedulers to run"};
   57:         _ ->
   58: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   59:             Config
   60:     end;
   61: init_per_testcase(erl_1199, Config) ->
   62:     SO = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
   63:     [{schedulers_online, SO}|Config];
   64: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_testcase(erl_1199, Config) ->
   68:     {value, {schedulers_online, SO}} = lists:keysearch(schedulers_online,
   69:                                                        1, Config),
   70:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
   71:         SO ->
   72:             ok;
   73:         _ ->
   74:             erlang:system_info(schedulers_online, SO),
   75:             SO = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)
   76:     end,
   77:     Config;
   78: end_per_testcase(receive_opt_deferred_save, Config) ->
   79:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   80:     Config;
   81: end_per_testcase(_Name, Config) ->
   82:     Config.
   83: 
   84: call_with_huge_message_queue(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   85:     Pid = spawn_link(fun echo_loop/0),
   86:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
   87:     _WarmUpTime = time_calls(Pid),
   88:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
   89:     Time = time_calls(Pid),
   90:     io:format("Time for empty message queue: ~p", [Time]),
   91:     _ = [self() ! {msg,N} || N <- lists:seq(1, 500000)],
   92:     call_with_huge_message_queue_1(Pid, Time, 5).
   93: 
   94: call_with_huge_message_queue_1(_Pid, _Time, 0) ->
   95:     ct:fail(bad_ratio);
   96: call_with_huge_message_queue_1(Pid, Time, NumTries) ->
   97:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
   98:     HugeTime = time_calls(Pid),
   99:     io:format("Time for huge message queue: ~p", [HugeTime]),
  100: 
  101:     case (HugeTime+1) / (Time+1) of
  102:         Q when Q < 10 ->
  103: 	    {comment, "Ratio: "++erlang:float_to_list(Q)};
  104:         Q ->
  105:             io:format("Too high ratio: ~p\n", [Q]),
  106:             call_with_huge_message_queue_1(Pid, Time, NumTries-1)
  107:     end.
  108: 
  109: %% Time a number calls. Try to avoid returning a zero time.
  110: time_calls(Pid) ->
  111:     time_calls(Pid, 10).
  112: 
  113: time_calls(_Pid, 0) ->
  114:     0;
  115: time_calls(Pid, NumTries) ->
  116:     case timer:tc(fun() -> calls(Pid) end) of
  117:         {0,ok} ->
  118:             time_calls(Pid, NumTries-1);
  119:         {Time,ok} ->
  120:             Time
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: calls(Pid) ->
  124:     calls(10000, Pid).
  125: 
  126: calls(0, _) -> ok;
  127: calls(N, Pid) ->
  128:     {ok,{ultimate_answer,42}} = call(Pid, {ultimate_answer,42}),
  129:     calls(N-1, Pid).
  130: 
  131: call(Pid, Msg) ->
  132:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  133:     Pid ! {Mref,{self(),Msg}},
  134:     receive
  135: 	{Mref, Reply} ->
  136: 	    erlang:demonitor(Mref, [flush]),
  137: 	    {ok, Reply};
  138: 	{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Reason} ->
  139: 	    exit(Reason)
  140:     end.
  141: 
  142: receive_in_between(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  143:     Pid = spawn_link(fun echo_loop/0),
  144:     [{ok,{a,b}} = call2(Pid, {a,b}) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100000)],
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: call2(Pid, Msg) ->
  148:     self() ! dummy,
  149:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  150:     Pid ! {Mref,{self(),Msg}},
  151:     receive_one(),
  152:     receive
  153: 	{Mref,Reply} ->
  154: 	    erlang:demonitor(Mref, [flush]),
  155: 	    {ok,Reply};
  156: 	{'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} ->
  157: 	    exit(Reason)
  158:     end.
  159: 
  160: receive_one() ->
  161:     receive
  162: 	dummy -> ok
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: receive_opt_exception(_Config) ->
  166:     Recurse = fun() ->
  167:                       %% Overwrite with the same mark,
  168:                       %% and never consume it.
  169:                       ThrowFun = fun() -> throw(aborted) end,
  170:                       aborted = (catch do_receive_opt_exception(ThrowFun)),
  171:                       ok
  172:               end,
  173:     do_receive_opt_exception(Recurse),
  174: 
  175:     %% Eat the second message.
  176:     receive
  177:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) -> ok
  178:     end.
  179: 
  180: do_receive_opt_exception(Disturber) ->
  181:     %% Create a receive mark.
  182:     Ref = make_ref(),
  183:     self() ! Ref,
  184:     Disturber(),
  185:     receive
  186:         Ref ->
  187:             ok
  188:     after 0 ->
  189:             error(the_expected_message_was_not_there)
  190:     end.
  191: 
  192: receive_opt_recursion(_Config) ->
  193:     Recurse = fun() ->
  194:                       %% Overwrite with the same mark,
  195:                       %% and never consume it.
  196:                       NoOp = fun() -> ok end,
  197:                       BlackHole = spawn(NoOp),
  198:                       expected = do_receive_opt_recursion(BlackHole, NoOp, true),
  199:                       ok
  200:               end,
  201:     do_receive_opt_recursion(self(), Recurse, false),
  202:     ok.
  203: 
  204: do_receive_opt_recursion(Recipient, Disturber, IsInner) ->
  205:     Ref = make_ref(),
  206:     Recipient ! Ref,
  207:     Disturber(),
  208:     receive
  209:         Ref -> ok
  210:     after 0 ->
  211:             case IsInner of
  212:                 true ->
  213:                     expected;
  214:                 false ->
  215:                     error(the_expected_message_was_not_there)
  216:             end
  217:     end.
  218: 
  219: 
  220: %% Test that the receive opt behaves correctly when
  221: %% the messages are in the middle queue. It only triggers
  222: %% a very special scenario that OTP-16241 solves.
  223: receive_opt_deferred_save(_Config) ->
  224: 
  225:     %% This testcase is very very white-boxy, but I'm not
  226:     %% sure what to do about that.
  227: 
  228:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun() ->
  229:                         deferred()
  230:                 end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
  231:     spawn_opt(fun() ->
  232:                       link(Pid),
  233:                       Lst = lists:seq(1,200),
  234:                       Pid ! go,
  235:                       %% Sleep in order to make sure that Pid gets
  236:                       %% scheduled in.
  237:                       erts_debug:set_internal_state(sleep, 250),
  238:                       Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  239:                       [Pid ! I || I <- Lst],
  240:                       Pid ! stop,
  241:                       receive
  242:                           {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
  243:                               ok
  244:                       after 2000 ->
  245:                               exit(stop_timeout)
  246:                       end
  247:               end,[{scheduler,1},monitor]),
  248:     receive
  249:         {'DOWN',_, process, _, normal} ->
  250:             ok;
  251:         {'DOWN',_, process, _, Reason} ->
  252:             ct:fail(Reason)
  253:     end.
  254: 
  255: deferred() ->
  256:     receive
  257:         go ->
  258:             %% Sleep for a while so that the middle queue
  259:             %% is filled
  260:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(sleep, 1000)
  261:     end,
  262: 
  263:     %% Here the inner queue should be empty and the middle queue
  264:     %% should have 200 messages and one monitor signal.
  265:     %% The monitor signal is important as otherwise all messages
  266:     %% will just be moved from the outer to the inner queue
  267:     %% immediately.
  268: 
  269:     %% Setup the receive opt mark
  270:     %% This receive opt is as of PR-2439 disabled, though future
  271:     %% optimizations may enable it again....
  272:     Ref = make_ref(),
  273:     self() ! Ref,
  274: 
  275:     %% Call another function that does a non-receive opt receive.
  276:     %% Before OTP-16241 this would hang as the save marker in the
  277:     %% message queue would be incorrectly set.
  278:     deferred(1,200),
  279: 
  280:     %% Get the ref using receive opt here.
  281:     receive
  282:         Ref ->
  283:             ok
  284:     end,
  285:     receive
  286:         stop ->
  287:             erlang:display(ok)
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: deferred(N,M) when N > M ->
  291:     ok;
  292: deferred(N,M) ->
  293:     receive
  294:         N ->
  295:             deferred(N+1,M)
  296:     end.
  297: 
  298: erl_1199(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  299:     %% Whitebox testing for issue in ERL-1199/OTP-16572
  300:     %%
  301:     %% When the bug hits, the client save pointer will be pointing to
  302:     %% a message later than the actual message we want to match on.
  303:     %%
  304:     %% In order to trigger the bug we want to have messages in the
  305:     %% message queue (inner queue) and get scheduled out while we are
  306:     %% working with signals in the middle queue and have handled signals
  307:     %% past the save_last pointer while it is deferred (possibly pointing
  308:     %% into the middle queue). When this happens the save pointer is set
  309:     %% to the end of the message queue (to indicate that we need to
  310:     %% handle more signals in the middle queue before we have any
  311:     %% messages that can match) via deferred save. The save_last pointer
  312:     %% now points into the message queue but we cannot determine that
  313:     %% since we don't know if we have handled signals past it or not. The
  314:     %% main issue here is that we did not keep the deferred_save flag so
  315:     %% we later can adjust save_last when we know longer have a
  316:     %% deferred_save_last.
  317:     %%
  318:     %% The testcase tries with a psequdo random amount of signals, over
  319:     %% and over again, which makes it likely to hit the bug if reintroduced
  320:     %% even if reduction costs etc are changed. The test-case, at the
  321:     %% time of writing, consistently fail (on my machine) while the bug is
  322:     %% present.
  323:     %%
  324:     SO = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  325:     try
  326:         process_flag(priority, high),
  327:         Srv = spawn_opt(fun erl_1199_server/0, [link, {priority, max}]),
  328:         Clnt = spawn_opt(fun () -> erl_1199_client(Srv) end,
  329:                          [link, {priority, normal},
  330:                           {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  331:         Srv ! {client, Clnt},
  332:         receive after 10000 -> ok end,
  333:         Responsive = make_ref(),
  334:         Clnt ! {responsive_check, self(), Responsive},
  335:         Result = receive
  336:                      Responsive ->
  337:                          ok
  338:                  after 10000 ->
  339:                          hanging_client
  340:                  end,
  341:         unlink(Clnt),
  342:         exit(Clnt, kill),
  343:         unlink(Srv),
  344:         exit(Srv, kill),
  345:         %% Wait for terminations...
  346:         false = is_process_alive(Clnt),
  347:         false = is_process_alive(Srv),
  348:         ok = Result
  349:     after
  350:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
  351:     end.
  352: 
  353: erl_1199_server() ->
  354:     receive
  355: 	{client, Clnt} ->
  356: 	    rand:seed(exrop, 4711),
  357: 	    BEN = fun () -> Clnt ! {blipp}, exit(Clnt, normal) end,
  358: 	    erl_1199_server(Clnt, BEN)
  359:     end.
  360: 
  361: erl_1199_server(Clnt, BEN) ->
  362:     receive
  363: 	prepare ->
  364: 	    Extra = rand:uniform(10000),
  365: 	    erl_1199_do(BEN, 1000),
  366: 	    erl_1199_do(BEN, Extra);
  367: 	{request, Ref} ->
  368: 	    Extra = rand:uniform(10000),
  369: 	    erl_1199_do(BEN, 1000),
  370: 	    erl_1199_do(BEN, Extra),
  371: 	    Clnt ! Ref, %% Response...
  372: 	    erl_1199_do(BEN, 1000),
  373: 	    erl_1199_do(BEN, Extra)
  374:     end,
  375:     erl_1199_server(Clnt, BEN).
  376: 
  377: erl_1199_do(_Fun, 0) ->
  378:     ok;
  379: erl_1199_do(Fun, N) ->
  380:     Fun(),
  381:     erl_1199_do(Fun, N-1).
  382: 
  383: erl_1199_client(Srv) ->
  384:     Srv ! prepare,
  385:     erlang:yield(),
  386:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Srv),
  387:     Srv ! {request, Ref},
  388:     erlang:yield(),
  389:     receive
  390: 	Ref -> ok;
  391: 	{'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} -> ok
  392:     end,
  393:     erl_1199_flush_blipp(),
  394:     receive
  395: 	{responsive_check, From, FromRef} ->
  396: 	    From ! FromRef
  397:     after
  398: 	0 ->
  399: 	    ok
  400:     end,
  401:     erl_1199_client(Srv).
  402: 
  403: erl_1199_flush_blipp() ->
  404:     receive
  405: 	{blipp} ->
  406: 	    erl_1199_flush_blipp()
  407:     after 0 ->
  408: 	    ok
  409:     end.
  410: 
  411: multi_recv_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  412:     HugeMsgQ = 500000,
  413:     Srv = spawn_link(fun multi_echoer/0),
  414:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  415:     _WarmUpTime = time_multi_call(Srv, fun multi_call/1),
  416:     EmptyTime = time_multi_call(Srv, fun multi_call/1),
  417:     io:format("Time with empty message queue: ~p microsecond~n",
  418: 	      [erlang:convert_time_unit(EmptyTime, native, microsecond)]),
  419:     _ = [self() ! {msg,N} || N <- lists:seq(1, HugeMsgQ)],
  420:     HugeTime = time_multi_call(Srv, fun multi_call/1),
  421:     io:format("Time with huge message queue: ~p microsecond~n",
  422: 	      [erlang:convert_time_unit(HugeTime, native, microsecond)]),
  423:     Q = HugeTime / EmptyTime,
  424:     HugeMsgQ = flush_msgq(),
  425:     case Q > 10 of
  426: 	true ->
  427: 	    ct:fail({ratio, Q});
  428: 	false ->
  429: 	    {comment, "Ratio: "++erlang:float_to_list(Q)}
  430:     end.
  431:     
  432: multi_echoer() ->
  433:     receive
  434: 	{Mref, From, Msg, Responses} ->
  435: 	    multi_response(Mref, From, Msg, Responses);
  436: 	_Garbage ->
  437: 	    ok
  438:     end,
  439:     multi_echoer().
  440: 
  441: multi_response(_Mref, _From, _Msg, 0) ->
  442:     ok;
  443: multi_response(Mref, From, Msg, N) ->
  444:     From ! {Mref, Msg},
  445:     multi_response(Mref, From, Msg, N-1).
  446: 
  447: time_multi_call(Srv, Fun) ->
  448:     garbage_collect(),
  449:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  450:     ok = Fun(Srv),
  451:     erlang:monotonic_time() - Start.
  452:     
  453: multi_call(Srv) ->
  454:     Resp = 100,
  455:     NoOp = fun () -> ok end,
  456:     Fun3 = fun () ->
  457: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, three, Resp, false, NoOp)
  458: 	   end,
  459:     Fun2 = fun () ->
  460: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two, Resp, false, Fun3)
  461: 	   end,
  462:     multi_call(Srv, 1000, one, Resp, false, Fun2).
  463: 
  464: multi_call(_Srv, 0, _Msg, _Responses, _Clear, _Fun) ->
  465:     ok;
  466: multi_call(Srv, N, Msg, Responses, Clear, Fun) ->
  467: 
  468:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Srv),
  469: 
  470:     Srv ! {Mref, self(), Msg, Responses},
  471:     Fun(),
  472:     multi_receive(Mref, Msg, Responses),
  473:     erlang:demonitor(Mref, [flush]),
  474:     multi_call(Srv, N-1, Msg, Responses, Clear, Fun).
  475:     
  476: multi_receive(_Mref, _Msg, 0) ->
  477:     ok;
  478: multi_receive(Mref, Msg, N) ->
  479: 
  480:     receive
  481: 	{Mref, RMsg} ->
  482: 	    Msg = RMsg;
  483: 	{'DOWN', Mref, process, _, Reason} ->
  484: 	    exit({server_error, Reason})
  485:     end,
  486:     multi_receive(Mref, Msg, N-1).
  487: 
  488: multi_recv_opt_clear(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  489:     %% Whitebox: we know that we have at most 8 active
  490:     %% receive markers...
  491:     %%
  492:     %% We here test a scenario where we need clear instructions
  493:     %% to be issued when the a receive marker is no longer
  494:     %% needed. If no clear instructions are issued, we will
  495:     %% reuse the marker for the outer call which will cause
  496:     %% scans of the whole message queue when receiving outer
  497:     %% results...
  498:     %%
  499:     HugeMsgQ = 500000,
  500:     Srv = spawn_link(fun multi_echoer/0),
  501:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  502:     _WarmUpTime = time_multi_call(Srv, fun multi_call_clear/1),
  503:     EmptyTime = time_multi_call(Srv, fun multi_call_clear/1),
  504:     io:format("Time with empty message queue: ~p microsecond~n",
  505: 	      [erlang:convert_time_unit(EmptyTime, native, microsecond)]),
  506:     _ = [self() ! {msg,N} || N <- lists:seq(1, HugeMsgQ)],
  507:     HugeTime = time_multi_call(Srv, fun multi_call_clear/1),
  508:     io:format("Time with huge message queue: ~p microsecond~n",
  509: 	      [erlang:convert_time_unit(HugeTime, native, microsecond)]),
  510:     Q = HugeTime / EmptyTime,
  511:     HugeMsgQ = flush_msgq(),
  512:     case Q > 10 of
  513: 	true ->
  514: 	    ct:fail({ratio, Q});
  515: 	false ->
  516: 	    {comment, "Ratio: "++erlang:float_to_list(Q)}
  517:     end.
  518: 
  519: multi_call_clear(Srv) ->
  520:     NoOp = fun () -> ok end,
  521:     Fun2 = fun () ->
  522: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two0, 2, true, NoOp),
  523: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two1, 2, true, NoOp),
  524: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two2, 2, true, NoOp),
  525: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two3, 2, true, NoOp),
  526: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two4, 2, true, NoOp),
  527: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two5, 2, true, NoOp),
  528: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two6, 2, true, NoOp),
  529: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two7, 2, true, NoOp),
  530: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two8, 2, true, NoOp),
  531: 		   multi_call(Srv, 1, two9, 2, true, NoOp)
  532: 	   end,
  533:     multi_call(Srv, 1000, one, 100, true, Fun2).
  534:   
  535: gh_5235_missing_save_reset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  536:     %%
  537:     %% Used to hang in the second receive due to save
  538:     %% pointer not being reset on bad timeout value...
  539:     %%
  540:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  541:     id(self()) ! init,
  542:     try
  543:         receive blipp -> ok after blupp -> ok end
  544:     catch _:_ ->
  545:             ok
  546:     end,
  547:     receive init -> ok end,
  548: 
  549:     %% Try with a timeout value not known in compile
  550:     %% time as well...
  551:     id(self()) ! init2,
  552:     try
  553:         receive blapp -> ok after id(blepp) -> ok end
  554:     catch _:_ ->
  555:             ok
  556:     end,
  557:     receive init2 -> ok end.
  558: 
  559: gh_5235_recv_mark(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  560:     %%
  561:     %% Used to leak a recv marker into the receive
  562:     %% via erts_msgq_peek_msg() due to save pointer
  563:     %% not being reset on bad timeout value...
  564:     %%
  565:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  566:     id(self()) ! init,
  567:     try
  568:         receive blipp -> ok after blupp -> ok end
  569:     catch _:_ ->
  570:             ok
  571:     end,
  572:     Ref = make_ref(),
  573:     id(self()) ! Ref,
  574:     receive init -> ok end,
  575:     receive Ref -> ok end,
  576:     
  577:     %% Try with a timeout value not known in compile
  578:     %% time as well...
  579:     id(self()) ! init2,
  580:     try
  581:         receive blapp -> ok after id(blepp) -> ok end
  582:     catch _:_ ->
  583:             ok
  584:     end,
  585:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
  586:     id(self()) ! Ref2,
  587:     receive init2 -> ok end,
  588:     receive Ref2 -> ok end.
  589: 
  590: %% ERIERL-905: The `recv_marker_reserve` instruction didn't update heap/stack
  591: %% pointers despite allocating memory after a per-process counter goes beyond
  592: %% MAX_SMALL.
  593: recv_marker_reserve(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     Retries = 500,
  595:     {MinSmall, MaxSmall} = determine_small_limits(0),
  596:     Counter = -MinSmall + MaxSmall - Retries,
  597: 
  598:     DummyRef = make_ref(),
  599:     self() ! DummyRef,
  600: 
  601:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  602:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(process_uniq_counter, Counter),
  603:     recv_marker_reserve_retry(Retries * 2),
  604:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  605: 
  606:     receive
  607:         DummyRef -> ok
  608:     end.
  609: 
  610: recv_marker_reserve_retry(0) ->
  611:     ok;
  612: recv_marker_reserve_retry(N) ->
  613:     Ref = monitor(process, self(), [{alias,demonitor}]),
  614:     self() ! Ref,
  615:     receive
  616:         Ref -> erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush])
  617:     end,
  618:     recv_marker_reserve_retry(N - 1).
  619: 
  620: determine_small_limits(N) ->
  621:     case is_small(-1 bsl N) of
  622:         true -> determine_small_limits(N + 1);
  623:         false -> {-1 bsl (N - 1), (1 bsl (N - 1)) - 1}
  624:     end.
  625: 
  626: is_small(N) when is_integer(N) ->
  627:     0 =:= erts_debug:flat_size(N).
  628: 
  629: 
  630: %%%
  631: %%% Common helpers.
  632: %%%
  633: 
  634: id(X) -> X.
  635: 
  636: flush_msgq() ->
  637:     flush_msgq(0).
  638: flush_msgq(N) ->
  639:     receive
  640: 	_ ->
  641: 	    flush_msgq(N+1)
  642:     after 0 ->
  643: 	    N
  644:     end.
  645: 
  646: echo_loop() ->
  647:     receive
  648: 	{Ref,{Pid,Msg}} ->
  649: 	    Pid ! {Ref,Msg},
  650: 	    echo_loop()
  651:     end.
